messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2860
messages.msgSnippet: ... That is very nicely said, Rachel Ann.  I appreciate your insights into Jewish law and practice, as well.  We hear the Christian perspective so often.
messages.messageBody:
1/13/03 20:44:

> My child and my unborn child are different in an emotional, and I feel legal
> sense. I guess I see it this way; were I drowning, and my child drowning,
> and a choice must be made, please save my child. Even if I'm pregnant. Even
> if the baby is about to be born. The child I have held, nursed, and loved
> is the one whose rights take precedence.....

That is very nicely said, Rachel Ann. I appreciate your insights into
Jewish law and practice, as well. We hear the Christian perspective so
often.

brenda
